Our committee says: Hands off! https://t.co/6d‚Ä¶

name: Rep. Linda S√°nchez
tweet_text: RT @AFGENational: What good is a payroll tax cut if you don‚Äôt have a paycheck? - @RepLindaSanchez @WaysMeansCmte

name: Rep. Linda S√°nchez
tweet_text:
RT @SSWorks: "Social Security is an earned benefit that every worker pays into.

It is a sacred trust that workers make to their future sel‚Ä¶

name: Rep. Linda S√°nchez
tweet_text:
RT @SSWorks: My colleagues' proposal is to legitimize the President's dangerous payroll tax deferral.

It would be the first step towards d‚Ä¶

name: Rep. Linda S√°nchez
tweet_text: We did it before when we passed the #CARESAct, and we can do it again. /end

name: Rep. Linda S√°nchez
tweet_text: Let‚Äôs be honest with ourselves and our constituents: wishful thinking will not end this pandemic. We can‚Äôt pretend like it is over. But we can get real relief to families immediately if we stop living in denial and deal with the magnitude of this crisis.

name: Rep. Linda S√°nchez
tweet_text: For the 75 percent of Latinx retirees that depend on Social Security for the majority of their retirement income, maintaining that trust is a matter of survival.

name: Rep. Linda S√°nchez
tweet_text:
Doing so would cut off benefits in just a few years and undermine the central tenet of Social Security. 
‚ùåIt is not an entitlement. 
‚ùåIt is not a handout. 
‚úî It is an earned benefit that every worker pays into. 
‚úîIt is a sacred trust that workers make to their future selves.

name: Rep. Linda S√°nchez
tweet_text: Instead, my colleagues' proposal is to legitimize the president‚Äôs dangerous payroll tax deferral. It would be the first step toward doing away with Social Security‚Äôs dedicated funding altogether. The president has said he wants to eliminate the payroll tax numerous times.

name: Rep. Linda S√°nchez
tweet_text:
A good place to start would be extending the full $600 federal unemployment benefit. 

And we should give families additional economic impact payments so they can keep their heads above water. 

We passed this assistance in the House ** more than four months ago **.

name: Rep. Linda S√°nchez
tweet_text: What good is a payroll tax cut when you don‚Äôt have the ability to earn a paycheck? There are countless more effective ways we can help families right now, and we can do so without undermining Social Security‚Äôs dedicated revenue stream.

name: Rep. Linda S√°nchez
tweet_text: Families need real help, and they need it now. Instead, all they got was a cut to their unemployment benefits and a payroll tax deferral that no one asked for. If it weren‚Äôt a matter of life and death, deferring taxes on nonexistent or sharply reduced wages would be laughable.

name: Rep. Linda S√°nchez
tweet_text: And the countless Latinx workers in higher wage sectors still face pay disparities that result in lower lifetime earnings than their white counterparts. As a result, every Latinx worker‚Äôs contribution to Social Security is all the more critical to their retirement.

name: Rep. Linda S√°nchez
tweet_text: They put themselves in harm‚Äôs way on a daily basis while the rest of our community is hurting from higher rates of layoffs and reduced wages. That‚Äôs because Latinx workers also make up a disproportionate share of the labor force in industries most affected by the pandemic.

name: Rep. Linda S√°nchez
tweet_text:
I'm testifying at a @WaysMeansCmte hearing on #SocialSecurity. 

The COVID-19 pandemic has hurt every community in our country. But it has hit some far harder than others. The essential labor force is disproportionately made up of Latinx workers. /thread
